required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness Of A Physiotherapy Treatment Plan In Lateral Epicondylalgia
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness Of A Physiotherapy Treatment Plan In Lateral Epicondylalgia Case Report

brief_summary.textblock: Purpose: Test the effectiveness of a physiotherapy treatment in a patient with Lateral epicondylalgia (LE).

detailed_description.textblock: Methods: LE is a musculoskeletal pain around the lateral epicondyle that can also happen with a decrease in grip strength and/or neuromuscular disorders. It is established a plan of treatment base on the evidence for dry needling, stretching and eccentric exercise in the patient with lateral epicondylalgia. This is done in two sessions, one session every 10 days and with a duration of about 45 minutes.

primary_outcome.description: score in discomfort hand 0-10. 0 is the lowest score and 10 is the highest score.

secondary_outcome.description: pain when performing static pressures measured with an algometer

arm_group.description: It is established a plan of treatment base on the evidence for dry needling, stretching and eccentric exercise in the patient with lateral epicondylalgia. This is done in two sessions, one session every 10 days and with a duration of about 45 minutes.

intervention.description: dry needling, stretching and eccentric exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed with lateral epicondylalgia
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed with compressive nerve syndromes with irradiation to the upper limb
